summary: This FBI situational report details the status of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and the ongoing sex trafficking investigation on Little St. James island as of August 13, 2019. It outlines investigative plans, reveals that MCC staff falsified logs, and provides a timeline of events leading to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the death investigation and the subject of the sex trafficking investigation. The report details his suicide attempts, death, and the circumstances surrounding it.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Epstein's cell mate at the MCC who was released on the morning of August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell. An interview with him was tentatively scheduled.

persons.name: Daphne Wallace
persons.context: Identified as Epstein's property manager, associated with the business Southern Trust on St. Thomas in relation to the Little St. James island investigation.

persons.name: Dan Horowitz
persons.context: An attorney from New York, NY, who advised that two property managers would not be available for interviews as part of the Little St. James investigation.

connections.description: Were cell mates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) until Reyes was released on August 9, 2019.
Epstein employed Daphne Wallace as his property manager, as identified in the investigation of Little St. James island.

events.title: Epstein Remanded to MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was remanded to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch and evaluated by an MCC psychologist, with observations continuing until July 10.

events.title: First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Epstein first attempted suicide via hanging and was discovered unconscious in his cell at approximately 1:27 a.m. He was placed back on suicide watch until July 29.

events.title: Cell Mate Released; Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein's cell mate, Efrain Reyes, was released, leaving Epstein alone. Later that evening, an MCC officer allowed Epstein to make an approximately 20-minute phone call on an unsecured, unmonitored line.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his jail cell with a makeshift noose around his neck. He was pronounced dead after unsuccessful revival efforts.

events.title: SITREP Issued
events.description: FBI issues this situational report outlining the status of the death and sex trafficking investigations, including plans for video recovery and interviews.

events.title: Personnel Deployment to Little St. James
events.description: 45 personnel (including ERT, SWAT, CART) are scheduled to depart for Little St. James island to continue the sex trafficking investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Two MCC Correctional Officers falsified observation logs for Epstein's cell for the overnight hours of August 9-10, 2019, prompting a criminal investigation by the Office of Inspector General.
On the evening before his death, Epstein was allowed to make a 20-minute phone call on an unsecured and unmonitored line.
A witness who constructed the IT network on Little St. James over a decade ago identified pictures of a co-conspirator, victims, and other guests on the island.
Epstein was found alone in his cell after his cell mate, Efrain Reyes, was released on the morning of August 9, 2019.
The FBI was working to recover potentially corrupted video surveillance from the MCC and planned to remove the entire system for analysis.
